qas.question: When did the 'War Horse' book come out?
Which movie earned more, The Adventures of Tintin or War Horse?
Where was The Adventures of Tintin mostly made?

How many Academy Award nominations did The Adventures of Tintin receive?

context: Spielberg followed with War Horse, shot in <a0_0><b6_0>England<b6_0/><a0_0/> in the summer of <b7_0>2010<b7_0/>. It was released just four days after <b5_0>The Adventures of Tintin<b5_0/>, on <a1_0>December 25, 2011<a1_0/>. The film, based on the novel of the same name written by <a2_0>Michael Morpurgo<a2_0/> and published in <a3_0>1982<a3_0/>, follows the long friendship between a British boy and his horse Joey before and during World War I – the novel was also adapted into a hit play in London which is still running there, as well as on Broadway. The film was released and distributed by <a4_0><b8_0>Disney<b8_0/><a4_0/>, with whom DreamWorks made a distribution deal in 2009. War Horse received generally positive reviews from critics, and was nominated for <b9_0>six<b9_0/> Academy Awards, including Best Picture.
